Dear Graydon:
I don*t know what the decision is about the financing of the
meeting of all or part of theSchool Acceptance Committee, but
if there is to be a meeting ancf.'il it '"could'he 'heTH^tHeâ€™^week-
end of December 11 and 12 we should be glad to have you meet
in St. Louis. We could furnish meeting rooms at the station
but on the whole I think a hotel would be better.
I realize how many problems brought up at Norman were postponed
for this meeting. I also know that the weekend of December 11
and 12 was suggested as a possible time. Hence this note.
Hastily,
Marguerite Fleming, Director
